page.title: 06Housing. Hoo area.
page.content: Most of the houses in the area are of cottage type and are about 150-200 yrs old.A very small proportion of these are "tied" houses ,occupied by farm workers,although originally most of the cottages would have come within this category.Now they are much sought after as "period" homes & are "modernised" by their owners -often being colour-washed in the traditional Suffolk Pink.Most would originally have been thatched,but today only a few retain their thatch- notably those in Brandeston Street-the rest having been tiled. There are several large Georgian/Vict- orian type houses in the area & at least 2 sizeable Halls-one at Kettleburgh and one at Brandeston,the latter now being used as a preparatory school,with a residential development adjoining it for staff and pupils
